situation.title: Usual Situation
situation.description: Pet owners calling for urgent consultations, missed vaccine and checkup reminders, and difficulty managing multiple service types (consultations, grooming, emergencies).

problem.title: The Problem
problem.description: After-hours emergencies aren't handled until the next day, vaccine reminders are sent manually, and many owners forget follow-up appointments for their pets' chronic treatments.

action.title: System Action
action.description: Automatically classifies emergencies vs routine consultations, sends vaccine and preventive checkup reminders, manages appointments for different services, and keeps each pet's medical history accessible.

change.title: What Changes
change.description: Emergencies are captured 24/7, vaccination programs stay up-to-date automatically, the schedule optimizes space for emergencies, and owners feel more supported in caring for their pets.

cases.title: Stories that happen every week
cases.description: These aren't "marketing cases". They're messages almost every pet owner has sent at some point when they were truly worried.

midnight.title: Midnight vomiting
midnight.story: Your clinic is closed and the phone buzzes. A dog has been vomiting for hours and the owner doesn't know if it's serious or if it can wait. Without a fast response, they'll call the first emergency clinic that answers.
midnight.ownerMessage: Sorry for the time... 3 vomits in a row, he's lethargic and trembling a bit. Is this an emergency?
midnight.system: Asks key triage questions, flags red signs, proposes an urgent appointment when appropriate, and provides safe instructions while the visit gets confirmed.
midnight.outcome: The owner feels supported and the emergency ends up on your schedule, not at a competitor.

postSurgery.title: After surgery, the fear
postSurgery.story: The pet had surgery today. At home everything feels bigger: a whimper, a damp bandage, a strange look. The owner texts anxious because they don't want to "do something wrong".
postSurgery.ownerMessage: He had surgery this morning and now he won't move... is that normal? Do I give the meds now?
postSurgery.system: Responds with the post-op protocol, checks dosing/timing based on the case, and if there are warning signs, schedules a prioritized recheck.
postSurgery.outcome: Fewer panic calls, better follow-up, and more rechecks scheduled without friction.

chronic.title: The itch that won't stop
chronic.story: Chronic dermatitis is rarely one visit. It's photos, questions, shampoo changes and "today it's worse". Without follow-up, owners get frustrated and drop off.
chronic.ownerMessage: He's scratching again and made a sore... I'll send a photo. Should we change treatment?
chronic.system: Collects structured symptoms, requests the right info, proposes a control visit, and preserves case context so the vet can step in fully informed.
chronic.outcome: More continuity, less back-and-forth, and a care experience owners can feel.

vaccines.title: Vaccines and missed checkups
vaccines.story: Between work, kids and routines, many families remember "late". Pets fall behind and the clinic loses an easy appointment that keeps the schedule healthy.
vaccines.ownerMessage: I think it's time for a vaccine but I'm not sure which one or when... do you have a slot this week?
vaccines.system: Checks the record, explains what's due and why, offers suitable slots, confirms the appointment and sends reminders.
vaccines.outcome: More stable preventive programs and fewer gaps caused by missed follow-up.
